1: NFT stands for non-fungible token. This means that each token is unique and has its own identity with its own history. NFTs are not interchangeable like cryptocurrencies, but rather can be exchanged one to one, similar to delivering real estate or paintings. NFTs are usually a representation of an asset that cannot be duplicated, like artwork or property, although it could also represent an app or other digital service.
2: The NFT business allows us to create, issue and manage self-sovereign assets on the blockchain. It also offers a powerful mechanism for generating and storing unique asset identifiers.

7: NFT tokens are non-fungible, meaning that each token can have a different value, unlike traditional fungible cryptocurrency. It’s owned by a single person and is not divisible between multiple users. This can make managing transactions more efficient than using an ERC20 token on the Ethereum blockchain because they don't need to be transferred individually like a fungible token
8: NFTs offer a unique opportunity for businesses to earn and spend cryptocurrency in ways that are not possible with traditional cryptocurrencies or digital assets.
